See also: bésten

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German bezzist, from Old High German bezzisto, from Proto-Germanic *batistaz. Compare Low German best, Dutch best, English best, Danish bedst.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈbɛstn̩/, /ˈbɛstən/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Adjective[edit]

besten

  1. superlative degree of gut (best)

Northern Sami[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Kautokeino) IPA(key): /ˈpeːsːten/

Verb[edit]

bēsten

  1. first-person singular past indicative of beastit

Swedish[edit]

Noun[edit]

besten

  1. definite singular of best

Anagrams[edit]

  • benets, betens
